thread.title: Trump in bathrobe is fake news says Spicer | Daily Mail Online
thread.title_full: Trump in bathrobe is fake news says Spicer | Daily Mail Online

author: Geoff Earle
title: Trump in bathrobe is fake news says Spicer | Daily Mail Online
text: show ad Now Sean Spicer says the president doesn't wear a bathrobe as he denies report of chaos in the White House (but DailyMail.com can show you Trump used to be model them A LOT) The New York Times reported on the 'bungled rollout' of his immigration order and limitations of his 'improvisational approach' The story portrayed staff infighting, Trump watching TV in his bathrobe, and aides searching for the correct door knobs in the West Wing The paper reports Trump was 'not fully briefed' on the details of an executive order that put advisor Stephen Bannon on the National Security Council Trump hit back Monday, tweeting, calling a Times article 'total fiction' and says the paper is 'making up stories & sources!' White House press secretary Sean Spicer said the story had 'literally blatant factual errors' - including that the president does not wear a bathrobe DailyMail.com however can disclose a series of family photographs show him wearing them in the past Published: 17:44 GMT, 6 February 2017 | Updated: 02:11 GMT, 7 February 2017 106 shares
